snippet: Mayor Bill de Blasio said the city would spend $7.9 million to expand its immigration services, and Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo vowed to crack down on wage theft and exploitation of workers.
abstract: New York State Gov Andrew Cuomo and New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio outline plans to boost immigration services throughout city and state during National Immigrant Integration conference in Brooklyn; both offer strong rhetoric in defiance of anti-immigrant sentiment along with modest proposals for action.
lead_paragraph: Mayor Bill de Blasio said the city would spend $7.9 million to expand its immigration services, and Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo vowed to crack down on wage theft and exploitation of workers.

headline.main: New York to Aid Immigrants Amid Stalled National Reforms
headline.print_headline: Officials Outline Expansion of Immigrant Services
